model.interfaces

Interface IClassroomsDailyTime

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClassroomsDailyTime

    public interface IClassroomsDailyTime
extends java.io.Serializable
    Interface that defines a daily academic timetable IDailyTime for each classroom in Classrooms.values().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      It adds a subject in the daily timetable of a specific classroom.

      It gives back the daily timetable of a specific classroom.

      It gives back the course that takes place in a specific hour in a specific classroom.

      It removes from the daily timetable all the subjects in a specified classroom in the selected hours.

      It gives back a set containing in which classroom a course takes place in a specific hour.
      java.util.Set<Classrooms> whereTeaching(java.lang.String teach, int hour)
      It gives back a set containing in which classroom is the teacher of a specific hour.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        void add(ISubject sub,
         Classrooms room,
         int hour,
         int n)
        It adds a subject in the daily timetable of a specific classroom. It must be possible for a teacher to have two different classrooms at the same time for the same subject, but it will be impossible for the same teacher to have two different subject at the same time in two different classrooms.
        Parameters:
        sub - Subject to be added.
        room - Classroom in which the lesson takes place.
        hour - Lesson starting time.
        n - Number of consecutive hour in which the subject passed as a parameter starting from hour is taught.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if room is null, [se parte o] all selected hours in classrooms different from room contain a different subject sub but with the same teacher, or in the cases specified in the following method IDailyTime.add(ISubject, int, int).

      • remove

        void remove(Classrooms room,
            int hour,
            int n)
        It removes from the daily timetable all the subjects in a specified classroom in the selected hours.
        Parameters:
        room - Classroom in which lessons must be removed.
        hour - Hour in which we start to remove subjects.
        n - Number of consecutive hours in which we must remove subjects starting from hour.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if room is null or in the cases that are specified in the following method IDailyTime.remove(int, int).

      • getSubject

        java.util.Optional<ISubject> getSubject(Classrooms room,
                                        int hour)
        It gives back the course that takes place in a specific hour in a specific classroom.
        Parameters:
        room - The classroom in which it is necessary to look for the subject to be given back.
        hour - Hour in which it is necessary to look for the subject to be given back.
        Returns:
        The subject that will be hold at the time and in the classroom specified. It is used an Optional in order to avoid to give back null Optional in case that there is no subject in the selected hour.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if room is null or in the cases specified in the following method IDailyTime.getSubject(int).

      • getDailyTime

        IDailyTime getDailyTime(Classrooms room)
        It gives back the daily timetable of a specific classroom.
        Parameters:
        room - Classroom from which the daily timetable has to be copied.
        Returns:
        The daily timetable of the classroom room.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if room is null.

      • copy

        IClassroomsDailyTime copy()
        It creates a copy of itself, in order to respect the method #equals(Object).
        Returns:
        A copy of the object that call this method.

      • whereTeaching

        java.util.Set<Classrooms> whereTeaching(java.lang.String teach,
                                        int hour)
        It gives back a set containing in which classroom is the teacher of a specific hour.
        Parameters:
        teach - Name of the teacher of which we want to know where he gives his lesson in a specific hour.
        hour - Hour in which we have to look in order to find in which classroom he gives lesson.
        Returns:
        Set that contain classrooms or the empty set, in case that the teacher isn’t giving lesson in the specified hour or if teach is null.

      • wherePerforming

        java.util.Set<Classrooms> wherePerforming(ISubject sub,
                                          int hour)
        It gives back a set containing in which classroom a course takes place in a specific hour.
        Parameters:
        sub - Subject of which we want to know where it takes place in a specific hour.
        hour - Hour in which to look for in the different classrooms.
        Returns:
        Set containing classrooms or empty set in case lesson is not in the specified hour or if sub is null.
